p: That was another good letter. I note all you say, and have said, about the garden, and I've been genuinely intersted. There's nothing to say in return because the news is all on one side! But I think it's bully the way you've made the garden pay in spite of various cranky conditions of weather. I told Amama yesterday, that if you set your heart and mind on a task, you'd accomplish it.
Yesterday's note was mailed just as your letter arrived.

Many thanks, Ollie, for the offer to help me on the house payt. I have $100 yet, & should have a bit more. I owe $135 on Sept. 13. Kemper would solve all our problems nicely, but I'm still waiting for the final word. No doubt Hitch & the faculty as a whole want me; but there's some quandary as to arrangements. I have a final suggestion

to make, if the opportunity arises. At worst, I could run up to Boonville for two days each week, & Mama & I could stay with you'ns & do our rightful share. I'd consider such an arrnagement bully for we do want to be with you, and we'd be completely happy if we could keep a bit. With that scheme, we could actually reduce your present budget, while living for much less than a home in Boonville would cost.
Well, we'll see. Anyway, theree'll be something, and the assurance that we can be with you will make planning & scheming easier.
What you say of G. & co-ops is amusing, and true, I'm sure. His mental processes are emotional, characteristically feminie; and he's dear as well as able in his live.
How woudl you regard this suggestion? Is it not likely that when the co-operative movement is viewed historically, it may be seen to have been symptomatic rather than curative?
During the hey day of peace movements it seemed to me that they were symptomatic of the disease and not indicative of a world - will to peace. The parallel is not perfect, but does suggest the idea.
Incidentally, isn't the co-operative movemnt a phase of the deomcratic dream? And would you suspect that catastrophe will lead to democracy?
You know I don't care in the least one way or the other. Deep down in me I'm happy.
Just to think what a miracle it is that old Nei actually did come and is here? That's the way I feel & think about him.
Enot, I often see you around the kitchen and the house generally.
